channel.description:
Basically I want something like [table] [tr][td]Image location [/td][td][center] Description[/center][/td][/tr] [tr] [td]|text box here|[/td] [td]|another text box here|[/td] [/tr][/table] {Add another item button} {save button}

I need help on making a form that is compatible with dynamic additions(as in using javascript to add items to the form), and then saving all of those values into a MySQL database. And another php just echoing out the values as XML with the Doc type being text/xml the XML is in this format [php]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="yes"?>[/php] [php]<images> <pic> <image>picture1.jpg</image> <caption>its a picture</caption> </pic> <pic> <image>picture2.jpg</image> <caption>tis another picture</caption> </pic> </images>[/php]

I am almost done with the website, but in order to have it finished it needs a good slideshow(which is done) but also a way to edit that slideshow(which runs on XML)

item.title: [help me]PHP XML editor using forms
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

kloplop321:

so would I get the information out of $fields by using like $fields[1] like other arrays or what? Thanks sppt. Another thing, what do you use to split values by “//” for example?

well, like i did
[php]foreach($_POST[‘fields’] as $field) { //$_POST[‘fields’] is an array, created by putting name=“fields[]” in your tag
//do what you want in here
}[/php]
you can get the value from $field, which is the individual field, if i’m not mistaken.
Also, $_POST[‘fields’] should just work like any other multi-dimensional array, so you can access it like this, i think:
[php]$_POST[‘fields’][0][/php]

to split the values, you can use either explore or preg_split, the latter using regexes.
[php]explode("//", $var);
preg_split("////", $var);[/php]

@ron: he’s asking for a way to create a dynamic form, then put the form data into an XML file
